data.title: 161 Disney Trivia Questions for Every Level of Disney Fan
data.meta_description: From Disney trivia questions that’ll stump even Disney diehards to Disney questions anyone could answer, pull these out for your next Disney trivia game night.
data.text:
There is perhaps no better way to spend a game night than rolling through some Disney trivia questions. Given the company’s been churning out classics since 1937’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, there are more Disney trivia game questions than you’ll know what to do with.

The best way to go about hosting a Disney trivia game night is to assign someone the role of emcee. They’ll be the person who sees the trivia questions (and answers), picks the lineup, and ultimately facilitates your Disney trivia game. The emcee can also choose whether you play a round of general Disney trivia or if you divvy things up into more specific categories, because let’s face it: the wonderful world of Disney (trivia) is a big one. Luckily, we’ve done the work of creating categories for you.

Below, you’ll find themed Disney trivia questions and answers that cover a wide range of Disney and Pixar films, from mega-hits like Beauty and the Beast and Toy Story to more fringe fare. (Atlantis: The Lost Empire or Angels in the Outfield, anyone?) And, on the subject of fringe movies, we also added a section of tough Disney trivia for diehard fans. Playing with friends who don’t own 10 pairs of Mickey Mouse ears? We dedicated a category to easy Disney quiz questions and answers, too — perfect for your pals who “think they saw the ‘Let It Go’ movie once.”

So, what are you waiting for? Get a Disney movie night on the calendar so everyone can prep. Then, let the trivia games begin!

Below, find:

General Disney movie trivia: Animated edition

General Disney movie trivia: Live-action edition

Disney princess trivia

Disney villain trivia

Disney-Pixar movie trivia

Tough Disney trivia

Easy Disney quiz questions (and answers)

Disney movie trivia: Animated edition

Who composed the songs for Tarzan’s soundtrack? Answer: Phil Collins.

What does Rapunzel want to see on her birthday in Tangled? Answer: The floating lanterns.

In what fictional city does Aladdin primarily take place? Answer: Agrabah.

Who is Mufasa’s trusted advisor in The Lion King? Answer: Zazu.

Which animal does the enchanted cake in Brave turn Merida’s mother into? Answer: A bear.

What are the three things needed to fly, according to Peter Pan? Answer: Faith, trust, and pixie dust.

What’s the name of Remy’s hero in Ratatouille? Answer: Auguste Gusteau.

Who trained Hercules on how to be a hero? Answer: Philoctetes. (It’s OK if you say Phil!)

Where did the seven dwarfs in Snow White work? Answer: A diamond mine.

What kind of animal is Zootopia’s Judy Hopps? Answer: Rabbit.

Where did the film 101 Dalmatians take place? Answer: London.

What’s Goofy’s profession in A Goofy Movie? Answer: Photographer.

What’s the name of the snow creature Elsa created to send Anna, Kristoff, and Olaf away? Answer: Marshmallow.

How many sisters does Ariel have? Answer: Six.

What is the name of the Mulan character voiced by Eddie Murphy? Answer: Mushu.

What animal does the spirit of Moana’s grandmother take the form of? Answer: A manta ray. (You could say stingray.)

Where in the castle is Belle forbidden to go in Beauty and the Beast? Answer: The West Wing.

Which famous artist is an animated character in Coco? Answer: Frida Kahlo.

In The Jungle Book, what kind of animal is King Louis? Answer: Orangutan.

What sport did the Queen of Hearts enjoy playing in Alice in Wonderland? Answer: Croquet.

What is Sisu? Answer: A dragon (from the movie Raya and the Last Dragon).

What are the names of the two eels who are Ursula’s sidekicks? Answer: Flotsam and Jetsam.

Who are the three good fairies in Sleeping Beauty? Answer: Flora, Fauna, and Merryweather.

In Hercules, who are the two henchmen of Hades? Answer: Pain and Panic.

What city does Big Hero 6 take place in? Answer: San Fransokyo, a hybrid of San Francisco and Tokyo.

Disney movie trivia: Live-action edition

How many happy haunts is the Haunted Mansion home to? Answer: 999.

What was the name of the high school that Troy and Gabriella attend in High School Musical? Answer: East High.

Which actress plays Maleficent in the movie by the same name? Answer: Angelina Jolie.

Who directed the live-action adaptation of Alice in Wonderland, released in 2010? Answer: Tim Burton.

What’s the name of the Jonas Brothers’s band in Camp Rock? Answer: Connect 3. You can’t make that up.

What causes Dr. Tess Coleman (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her teen daughter Anna (Lindsay Lohan) to switch bodies in Freaky Friday? Answer: Magic fortune cookies.

What is the name of Will Turner’s father in Pirates of the Caribbean? Answer: Bootstrap Bill Turner.

In Mary Poppins Returns, who plays the role of Mary Poppins? Answer: Emily Blunt.

What sport does the titular Bud in Air Bud play? Answer: Basketball. In subsequent movies, the golden retriever plays basketball, football, soccer, baseball, and volleyball. Talk about a winning formula!

What’s the name of Lizzie McQuire’s lookalike in The Lizzie McQuire movie? Answer: Isabella Parigi.

What Academy Award-winning actress plays Miss Hannigan in the 1999 Disney movie Annie? Answer: Kathy Bates.

What famously queer-coded 2002 Disney Channel Original Movie stars Hillary Duff and Christy Carlson Romano? Answer: Cadet Kelly.

What play is being performed in Lindsay Lohan’s low-key magnum opus Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen? Answer: "Pygmalion" by George Bernard Shaw.

Who plays the absent-minded professor (subtly named Brainard) in Flubber? Answer: Robin Williams.

What are the names of the three animals in Homeward Bound? Answer: Shadow, Sassy, and Chance.

What character is responsible for the curse in Holes? Answer: Trick question! Madame Zeroni and Kissing Kate Barlow both leave curses.

What is the doll played by Tyra Banks called in Life Size? Answer: Eve.

What U.S. founding father is Nicholas Cage’s character named after in National Treasure? Answer: Benjamin Franklin. The character’s name is literally Benjamin Franklin Gates.

What live-action Disney movie was the first Disney movie to be inspired by the success of a Disney theme park ride? Answer: 1997’s Tower of Terror.

What 1992 musical stars a young Christian Bale and was billed as “bringing home labor issues to kids”? Answer: Newsies.

What DCOM basically predicted the modern smart home? Answer: Smart House.

What song is prominently featured in Remember the Titans and becomes an anthem for the team? Answer: "Ain't No Mountain High Enough" by Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell.

Brenden Fraser stars in this 1997 (honestly underrated) rom com and slapstick parody of a classic cartoon. Answer: George of the Jungle (it’s parodying Tarzan).

Who is Davy Jones in love with in Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest? Answer: Calypso, goddess of the sea.

What Disney movie was the actor Joseph Gordon-Levitt’s first starring role? Answer: Angels in the Outfield.

Disney princess trivia

What name did Mulan choose for herself when she pretended to be a man? Answer: Ping. (Bonus: In the 2020 live action film, her male name is Hua Jun.)

Which Disney character sings the song “How Far I’ll Go”? Answer: Moana.

What is Tiana's dream job in The Princess and the Frog? Answer: To own her own restaurant. (Princess Tiana is partly inspired by famed New Orleans restaurateur Leah Chase!)

Which shoe did Cinderella leave behind at the ball? Answer: Her left shoe.

Which Disney princess has brothers who are triplets? Answer: Merida.

There’s one Disney princess with a tattoo — who is it? Answer: Pocahontas.

What is the first name of the princess in Sleeping Beauty? Answer: Aurora.

What is the full name of Princess Mia in The Princess Diaries? Answer: Amelia Mignonette Thermopolis Renaldi in the movies. In the books, it’s Amelia Mignonette Grimaldi Thermopolis Renaldo.

Who plays Ariel in the 2023 live-action remake? Answer: Halle Bailey.

Whose pet and loyal companion is named Rajah? Answer: Princess Jasmine.

Besides famously voicing Ariel in the animated The Little Mermaid, to what other Disney movies did voice actor Jodi Benson lend her voice? Answer: She’s Toy Guide Barbie in the Toy Story movies, and she also voiced parts in Enchanted and Thumbelina.

Who is Elsa’s snowman companion? Answer: Olaf.

Which unofficial Disney princess “won’t say they’re in love”? Answer: Meg, or Megara, in Hercules.

What Disney princess — again unofficial, but honestly, what else could she be? — is voiced by Beyoncé? Answer: Nala in the live-action The Lion King remake.

What Disney character was first marketed by Disney as a Disney princess before they decided she looked too similar to Belle? Answer: Jane Porter from Tarzan.

Disney villain trivia

Who is the villain in The Hunchback of Notre Dame? Answer: Judge Claude Frollo.

What are the names of Cinderella’s evil stepsisters? Answer: Anastasia and Drizella.

Name five things no one has, does, or is like Gaston, per the song “Gaston.” Answers could be: Slick, quick, thick necked, swell cleft in his chin, a king pin, fights, douses lights, bites in a wrestling match, burly, brawny, hits, matches wits, spits in a spitting match, expectorates, shoots, makes those beauts, goes tromping around wearing boots. Up to you on whether other lyrics qualify!

Which Disney villain was memorably voiced by award-winning actor Jeremy Irons? Answer: Scar.

Who is Ursula the sea witch famously based on? Answer: The drag queen Divine.

The children of which four Disney villains star in the Descendents franchise? Answer: Cruella De Vil, Maleficent, the Evil Queen (from Snow White), and Jafar.

Which Disney villain has a pet raven named Diablo? Answer: Maleficent.

Which Disney villain has two “fools, idiots, and imbeciles” for sidekicks? Answer: Cruella de Vil.

What Disney villain is based on a spirit in Haitian Voodoo? Answer: Dr. Facilier (or “the Shadow Man,” who’s based on the loa, or spirit, Baron Samedi).

What villain does Cher (half-jokingly) believe she should play in a rumored upcoming Disney live-action remake? Answer: Mother Gothel from Tangled.

What is Captain Hook’s greatest fear? Answer: The crocodile that ate one of his hands. Which, fair.

What is the name of the villain in Bambi? Answer: He’s known only as “Man.” (If you said “the hunter,” we’ll give it to you!)

Which iconic actress voices the equally iconic villain in The Emperor’s New Groove? Answer: Eartha Kitt.

Shere Khan is the villain of what Disney classic? Answer: The Jungle Book.

What Disney villain is based on a real-life king of England? Answer: Prince John from Robin Hood.

Disney-Pixar movie trivia

What’s the name of the toy store featured in Toy Story 2? Answer: Al’s Toy Barn.

What’s the name of the fashion designer in The Incredibles? A: Edna Mode.

Which actor voiced the character of Lightning McQueen in the movie Cars? Answer: Owen Wilson.

What is the name of the city in Monsters, Inc.? Answer: Monstropolis.

What was Carl’s job before he retired in the movie Up? Answer: Balloon salesman.

What name did Mei give the red panda statues at the entrance of her family’s temple in Turning Red? Answer: Bart and Lisa.

What are Riley’s five emotions in Inside Out? Answer: Joy, sadness, anger, fear, and disgust.

What’s the name of Andy’s neighbor in Toy Story? Answer: Sid Phillips.

What’s the name of the fish Luca always has to chase down in Luca? Answer: Guiseppe.

What does “WALL-E” stand for? Answer: Waste Allocation Load Lifter: Earth Class.

What fruit does Lotso the bear smell like in Toy Story 3? Answer: Strawberries.

What's Boo’s real name on Monsters, Inc.? Answer: Mary.

What Disney-Pixar character says the famous “to infinity and beyond” line? Answer: Buzz Lightyear.

What color is anger in Inside Out? Answer: Red.

Which classic movie is Wall-E a fan of? Answer: Hello, Dolly!

In Finding Nemo, what kind of fish is Nemo? Answer: A clownfish.

Who is Joe Gardner’s mentee in the movie Soul? Answer: 22.

What kind of bug is Flik in A Bug’s Life? Answer: Ant.

What’s the name of the company in Monsters, Inc. that’s employed to scare children? Answer: Trick question! It’s Monsters, Inc.

In Onward, brothers Ian and Barley are on a quest to find what magical item? Answer: A Phoenix Gem.

Tough Disney trivia

How old is Crush (the surfer turtle) in Finding Nemo? Answer: 150 years.

Who composed the soundtrack for Toy Story? Answer: Randy Newman.

Who voice acted the Pocahontas character Thomas? Answer: Christian Bale.

Who is the oldest Disney princess? Answer: If you’re going by known ages only, Elsa is 21 for most of the action of Frozen and 24 in Frozen II, making her the oldest Disney princess. Some might say Giselle in Enchanted and Disenchanted, but her age is never explicitly stated.

What is Goofy’s son’s full name? Answer: Maximilian Goof.

In Lilo & Stitch, what experiment number is Stitch? Answer: Experiment 626.

What was the first film Disney ever released? Answer: Steamboat Willie.

Which song is the biggest Disney song of all time, per the Billboard Hot 100? Answer: “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” from Encanto, which spent five straight weeks at No. 1 on Billboard’s Hot 100, longer than any other Disney movie song has.

Which song is the second biggest Disney song of all time, per the Billboard Hot 100? Elton John’s “Can You Feel the Love Tonight” from The Lion King.

Which Disney prince is never named? Answer: Prince Charming in Cinderella.

What was the first Disney animated movie to be given a PG rating (instead of G)? Answer: The Black Cauldron.

What Hungarian-born actress and socialite voices both a cat and a mouse in Disney animated classics? Answer: Eva Gabor, who voiced Duchess in The Aristocats and Miss Bianca in The Rescuers movies.

How many fingers does Mickey Mouse have? Answer: Eight.

How did producers get the perfect lion's roar in The Lion King? Answer: They used a combination of tigers and and a famous voice actor; lions IRL don’t have a very ferocious-sounding roar. (Seriously!)

Who is the only title character in a Disney film that never speaks? Answer: Dumbo.

What are the names of the seven dwarfs? Answer: Doc, Happy, Sleepy, Dopey, Sneezy, Grumpy, and Bashful.

What were Mickey’s first words? Answer: Hot dogs!

The sorcerer’s name in Fantasia spells what backward? Answer: Disney.

What was Disney's most expensive animated film? Answer: Tangled.

What’s one word that Thumper teaches Bambi? Answer: Bird or flower.

In The Aristocats, what are the names of the three kittens? Answer: Berlioz, Marie, and Toulouse.

Which famous actors voice the main characters in The Fox and the Hound? Bonus point if you get each character’s names right. Answer: Mickey Rooney voices Tod the fox and Kurt Russell voices Copper the hound.

The jingle for what “can’t be beat” dog biscuit brand is featured in the animated 101 Dalmatians? Answer: Kanine Krunchies.

What movie featured Disney’s first use of computer-generated imagery (CGI) in its animation? Answer: The Black Cauldron in 1985.

What was the first-ever Disney Digital 3-D film? Answer: 2005’s Chicken Little.

What is the only Disney film to feature its own fictional language made specifically for that film? Answer: Atlantis: The Lost Empire. The language, Atlantean, was created for Disney by the same linguist who created the Klingon language for Star Trek.

What was Disney’s first animated sequel? Answer: 1990’s The Rescuers Down Under.

What noted stage, film, and TV actress, one of few performers to be nominated across all EGOT categories, voiced Mrs. Potts in Beauty and the Beast? Answer: Angela Lansbury.

The singer Peggy Lee sued Disney (and won) over what classic Disney movie? Answer: Lady and the Tramp, for which she wrote music and voiced four characters.

What live-action Disney film was pitched by a B-horror movie director who wanted to make a film his kids could watch? Answer: Honey, I Shrunk the Kids. (The director was Stuart Gordon, known for Re-Animator.)

Who is the only Disney princess we see become a mother? Answer: Ariel.

Easy Disney quiz questions (and answers)

Which fruit was intended to poison Snow White? Answer: An apple.

What movie gave us the line “Fish are friends not food”? Bonus point if you know who said it. Answer: Finding Nemo, Bruce.

Which Disney prince is the only main protagonist of a Disney film? Answer: Aladdin.

What is the name of Captain Hook’s ship in Peter Pan? Answer: The Jolly Roger.

What is the color of Ariel's finn in The Little Mermaid? Answer: Green.

With the voice of John Travolta, the title character of which 2008 Disney animated film is a white dog with a lightning-shaped marking on his coat? Answer: Bolt.

What’s the name of Elsa’s sister in Frozen? Answer: Anna.

What Disney movie is an adaptation of the Shakespeare play “Hamlet”? Answer: The Lion King.

Which actress played a set of twins in A Parent Trap? Answer: Lindsay Lohan.

Alice In Wonderland is based on a book by what author? Answer: Lewis Carroll.

Which famous wrestler was Maui’s voice actor in Moana? Answer: Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson.

What’s the last name of the three witch sisters in Hocus Pocus? Sanderson.

What does the Beast gift Belle with? Answer: A library.

Where do Winnie the Pooh and his friends live? Answer: The Hundred Acre Wood.

Which animal does Emperor Kuzco get turned into in the movie The Emperor’s New Groove? Answer: A llama.

Who voice acted Elsa in Frozen? Answer: Idina Menzel.

In The Nightmare Before Christmas, who is the Pumpkin King? Answer: Jack Skellington.

What kind of animal is Timon in The Lion King? A meerkat.

What is the name of the ship that Captain Jack Sparrow commands in the Pirates of the Caribbean series? Answer: The Black Pearl.

What Disney animated movie is inspired by Sherlock Holmes? Answer: The Great Mouse Detective.

Where is The Princess and the Frog primarily set? Answer: New Orleans.

What does “hakuna matata” mean? Answer: No worries.

In The Sword in the Stone, what is the real name of the boy who pulls the sword from the stone? Answer: Arthur. (We’ll also take Wart.)

In Lilo & Stitch, Lilo is cared for by whom? Answer: Her older sister, Nani.

What animated Disney movie is inspired by a work of Charles Dickens? Answer: Oliver & Company.

In The Hunchback of Notre Dame, who besides Esmerelda does Quasimodo count as friends? Answer: Three gargoyles.

What two animals are friends to Pocahontas? Answer: A racoon and a hummingbird.

In Beauty and the Beast, who is Lumiere dating? Answer: The feather duster.

In The Little Mermaid, where does Ursula store Ariel’s voice? Answer: Inside a shell necklace.

What are the antagonists in A Bug's Life? Answer: Grasshoppers.
